------------

Publishing our work allows us to share ideas and work collaboratively to advance the field of computer science.

[Learn more about our Publications Learn more](https://research.google/pubs/) [Publications](https://research.google/pubs/) 
    *   Resources
---------

We make products, tools, and datasets available to everyone with the goal of building a more collaborative ecosystem.

[Learn more about our Resources Learn more](https://research.google/resources/) [Resources](https://research.google/resources/) 

*    Programs & events 

Back to Programs & events menu

* * * 

Shaping the future, together.
-----------------------------

[Collaborate with us](https://research.google/programs-and-events/) 
    *   Student programs
----------------

Supporting the next generation of researchers through a wide range of programming.

[Learn more about our Student programs Learn more](https://research.google/programs-and-events/student-engagement/) [Student programs](https://research.google/programs-and-events/student-engagement/) 
    *   Faculty programs
----------------

Participating in the academic research community through meaningful engagement with university faculty.

[Learn more about our Faculty programs Learn more](https://research.google/programs-and-events/faculty-engagement/) [Faculty programs](https://research.google/programs-and-events/faculty-engagement/) 
    *   Conferences & events
--------------------

Connecting with the broader research community through events is essential for creating progress in every aspect of our work.

[Learn more about our Conferences & events Learn more](https://research.google/conferences-and-events/) [Conferences & events](https://research.google/conferences-and-events/) 

[Collaborate with us](https://research.google/programs-and-events/)

*   [Careers](https://research.google/careers/)
*   [Blog](https://research.google/blog/)

Search

Impossible? Let’s see.
======================

Whether we're shaping the future of sustainability, or optimizing algorithms, or even exploring epidemiological studies, Google Research strives to continuously progress science, advance society, and improve the lives of billions of people.

![Image 1: Person looking up at screen](https://storage.googleapis.com/gweb-research2023-media/original_images/primary-hero.jpg)

Whether we're shaping the future of sustainability, or optimizing algorithms, or even exploring epidemiological studies, Google Research strives to continuously progress science, advance society, and improve the lives of billions of people.

Advancing the state of the art
------------------------------

Our teams advance the state of the art through research, systems engineering, and collaboration across Google. We publish hundreds of research papers each year across a wide range of domains, sharing our latest developments in order to collaboratively progress computing and science.

Learn more about our [philosophy.](https://research.google/philosophy/)

![Image 2: Video preview image](https://research.google/)

Watch the film
--------------

[Link to Youtube Video](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8opIKE4p-Sk)

* * *

Read the latest
---------------

[See more publications](https://research.google/pubs/)[See more blog posts](https://research.google/blog/)

[![Image 3: GRatIO25-0-Hero](https://storage.googleapis.com/gweb-research2023-media/images/GRatIO25-0-Hero.width-800.png) May 22 · BLOG Google Research at Google I/O 2025](https://research.google/blog/google-research-at-google-io-2025/)[![Image 4: SufficientContext1_Hero](https://storage.googleapis.com/gweb-research2023-media/images/SufficientContext1_Hero.width-800.png) May 14 · BLOG Deeper insights into retrieval augmented generation: The role of sufficient context](https://research.google/blog/deeper-insights-into-retrieval-augmented-generation-the-role-of-sufficient-context/)[![Image 5: DPTrustGraph1_ExampleHero](https://storage.googleapis.com/gweb-research2023-media/images/DPTrustGraph1_ExampleHero.width-800.png) May 13 · BLOG Differential privacy on trust graphs](https://research.google/blog/differential-privacy-on-trust-graphs/)[![Image 6: Maya2_FirstGen](https://storage.googleapis.com/gweb-research2023-media/images/Maya2_FirstGen.width-800.png) May 12 · BLOG Bringing 3D shoppable products online with generative AI](https://research.google/blog/bringing-3d-shoppable-products-online-with-generative-ai/)[![Image 7: LICONN2-HeroFinal](https://storage.googleapis.com/gweb-research2023-media/images/LICONN2-HeroFinal.width-800.png) May 7 · BLOG A new light on neural connections](https://research.google/blog/a-new-light-on-neural-connections/)[![Image 8: Simplify1_SummaryHero](https://storage.googleapis.com/gweb-research2023-media/images/Simplify1_SummaryHero.width-800.png) May 6 · BLOG Making complex text understandable: Minimally-lossy text simplification with Gemini](https://research.google/blog/making-complex-text-understandable-minimally-lossy-text-simplification-with-gemini/)

Our research drives real-world change
-------------------------------------

* * *

Wildfires
---------

![Image 9: WIldfires_homepage-project-collage](https://storage.googleapis.com/gweb-research2023-media/images/WIldfires_homepage-project-collage.width-800.png)

Using AI to create a breakthrough in wildfire detection

[Learn more](https://sites.research.google/gr/wildfires/)Explore the research behind the project
*   [Watch Google AI’s wildfire detection technology](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=pmQlXLaHT_Y&t) Video  
*   [How a new constellation of satellites can detect smaller wildfires earlier](https://blog.google/outreach-initiatives/sustainability/google-ai-wildfire-detection) Blog  
*   [Discover how Google AI is helping firefighters detect wildfires](https://sites.research.google/gr/wildfires/firesat/) Research  
*   [Learn about EFA, the nonprofit established to launch the FireSat constellation](https://www.earthfirealliance.org/) Partner  

* * *

Mapping the Ionosphere
----------------------

![Image 10: Ionosphere_homepage](https://storage.googleapis.com/gweb-research2023-media/images/Ionosphere_homepage.width-800.png)

Mapping the ionosphere with Android phones

[Learn more](https://research.google/blog/mapping-the-ionosphere-with-the-power-of-android/)Explore the research behind the project
*   [Bringing atmospheric data down to Earth](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v%3DpwDX67hlBXg&sa=D&source=docs&ust=1731518060859809&usg=AOvVaw3Rt3vswmObsXn6dG50xLdh) Video  
*   [Mapping the Ionosphere with Millions of Phones](https://www.nature.com/articles/s41586-024-08072-x) Journal article  
*   [Explore crowdsourced maps of the ionosphere](https://youtu.be/NFahTZzIUA8) Video  
*   [American Geophysical Union (AGU) invited talk](https://agu.confex.com/agu/fm23/meetingapp.cgi/Paper/1238010) Publication  

* * *

Generative AI in health
-----------------------

![Image 11: Gen_AI_health](https://storage.googleapis.com/gweb-research2023-media/images/Gen_AI_health.width-800.png)

Transforming medicine with generative AI

[Learn more](https://blog.google/technology/health/google-generative-ai-healthcare/)Explore the research behind the project
*   [HeAR: A bioacoustic model designed to flag early signs of disease](https://blog.google/technology/health/ai-model-cough-disease-detection/) Blog  
*   [Advancing medical AI with Med-Gemini](https://research.google/blog/advancing-medical-ai-with-med-gemini/) Blog  
*   [AMIE: A research AI system for diagnostic medical reasoning and conversations](https://research.google/blog/amie-a-research-ai-system-for-diagnostic-medical-reasoning-and-conversations/) Blog  
*   [MedLM: generative AI fine-tuned for the healthcare industry](https://cloud.google.com/blog/topics/healthcare-life-sciences/introducing-medlm-for-the-healthcare-industry) Blog  

See our impact across other projects
------------------------------------

[See more projects](https://research.google/resources/our-projects/)

[![Image 12: Flood forecasting hero](https://storage.googleapis.com/gweb-research2023-media/images/Flood_forecasting_hero.width-800.png) Flood Forecasting The Flood Forecasting Initiative uses AI to make flood forecasting information universally accessible](https://sites.research.google/floodforecasting/)

[![Image 13: open building](https://storage.googleapis.com/gweb-research2023-media/images/open_building.width-800.png) Open Buildings A dataset of building footprints to support social good applications](https://sites.research.google/gr/open-buildings/)

[![Image 14: Languages](https://storage.googleapis.com/gweb-research2023-media/images/Anthem_Thumb_14.width-800.jpg) Languages How Google is expanding support for thousands of the world's languages](https://sites.research.google/languages/)

We work across domains
----------------------

Our vast breadth of work covers AI/ML foundations, responsible human-centric technology, science & societal impact, computing paradigms, and algorithms & optimization. Our research teams impact technology used by people all over the world.

[Explore research areas](https://research.google/research-areas/)

play silent looping video pause silent looping video

One research paper started it all
---------------------------------

The research we do today becomes the Google of the future. Google itself began with a research paper, published in 1998, and was the foundation of Google Search. Our ongoing research over the past 25 years has transformed not only the company, but how people are able to interact with the world and its information.

[See the original publication](https://research.google/pubs/the-anatomy-of-a-large-scale-hypertextual-web-search-engine/)

![Image 15: Legacy](https://storage.googleapis.com/gweb-research2023-media/images/Legacy.width-1250.jpg)

Responsible research is at the heart of what we do
--------------------------------------------------

The impact we create from our research has the potential to reach billions of people. That's why everything we do is guided by methodology that is grounded in responsible practices and thorough consideration.

[See how we're advancing AI](https://ai.google/responsibility/principles/?utm_source=researchgoogle&utm_medium=google-oo&utm_campaign=November2024&utm_content=module)

![Image 16: responsible-ai](https://storage.googleapis.com/gweb-research2023-media/images/responsible-ai.width-1250.jpg)

Help us shape the future
------------------------

[![Image 17: Academic community](https://storage.googleapis.com/gweb-research2023-media/images/Academic_community.width-800.png) Academic community We've been working alongside the academic research community since day one. Explore the ways that we collaborate and provide resources and support through a variety of student and faculty programs. See more programs](https://research.google/programs-and-events/)

[![Image 18: Career Opportunities](https://storage.googleapis.com/gweb-research2023-media/images/Career_Opportunities.width-800.png) Career opportunities From Accra to Zürich, to our home base in Mountain View, we’re looking for talented scientists, engineers, interns, and more to join our teams not only at Google Research but all research projects across Google. Learn more about careers](https://research.google/careers/)

Explore our other teams and product areas
-----------------------------------------

[Google AI](https://ai.google/?utm_source=researchgoogle&utm_medium=google-oo&utm_campaign=November2024&utm_content=footer)

Google LLC (Google), a subsidiary of Alphabet Inc, is a provider of search and advertising services on the internet. The company's business areas include advertising, search, platforms and operating systems, and enterprise and hardware products. Its portfolio of products and services includes Google Search, Google Chrome, Google Calendar, Google Docs, Google Drive, Google Photos, Google Meet, Google Finance, Google News, Google Play Books, Google Earth, Google Ad Manager, Google Play, AdMob, Google Maps, AdSense, Gmail, Google Groups, and YouTube. The company has a business presence across the Americas, Europe, Asia-Pacific, Africa, and the Middle East. Google is headquartered in Mountain View, California, the US.

Bring your best ideas to life with Google Workspace with Gemini. [Get tips & real-life use cases for using gen AI at work](/a/users/answer/14506784).

# Tips for research and development

## On this page

![](//storage.googleapis.com/support-kms-prod/mVyk7nWLuecrjc0F0MS2WTxDTYlezXKDgfAU)

![](//storage.googleapis.com/support-kms-prod/zbbYQfhPLBxvCBphFpcF0Ecb43yCdw5gNzhI)

![](//storage.googleapis.com/support-kms-prod/zbbYQfhPLBxvCBphFpcF0Ecb43yCdw5gNzhI)

Want advanced Google Workspace features for your business?

[Try Google Workspace today!](https://workspace.google.com/business/signup/welcome?utm_source=gwslearningcenter&utm_medium=support&utm_campaign=9283136)

[Expand all](#expand-all)  |  [Collapse all](?)

## Store files in one location

![](//storage.googleapis.com/support-kms-prod/BSa5YBhh4sIVEtou5SLnrm7fn48swpkx115q)

When working with a team to get a product to market, keep your work in a central location where everyone can securely store and access the files they need. Product managers and designers can easily collaborate and share confidential product designs, quality guidelines, Key Performance Indicators (KPIs), and mock-ups in a secure workspace using Google Drive or a shared drive. When someone incorporates feedback and approvals, Drive shows you what files have changed. Even better, you and your external clients can securely access the latest files remotely on any device.

#### Add files to Drive

If you're using the latest Chrome browser or Mozilla Firefox, you can drag files or folders from your computer into a Drive folder. Or, you can click **New**![and then](//storage.googleapis.com/support-kms-prod/Th2Tx0uwPMOhsMPn7nRXMUo3vs6J0pto2DTn)**File upload** or **Folder upload** and choose the file or folder you want to upload.

![and then](//storage.googleapis.com/support-kms-prod/Th2Tx0uwPMOhsMPn7nRXMUo3vs6J0pto2DTn)

#### Add files to a shared drive

*Requires at least **Contributor** access*

Any files you add are owned by the team. If you leave the shared drive, your files remain.

[Back to top ![](//storage.googleapis.com/support-kms-prod/zHHKMD6GSdDAAu4oBhTQPRgAXdaMqQjzkthj)](#top)

![](//storage.googleapis.com/support-kms-prod/zHHKMD6GSdDAAu4oBhTQPRgAXdaMqQjzkthj)

## Track product development

![](//storage.googleapis.com/support-kms-prod/BSa5YBhh4sIVEtou5SLnrm7fn48swpkx115q)

Keep track of sourcing activities for new products by creating a shared task list in Google Sheets. Create checklists to review new products and processes, then assign tasks to team members. Team members across the globe can directly update the task list in real time, without having to sift through everyone’s email updates. With everyone accessing and updating the same spreadsheet, it’s easier to distribute tasks and oversee development during all points of the product lifecycle.

#### Create a checklist in Sheets

![and then](//storage.googleapis.com/support-kms-prod/Th2Tx0uwPMOhsMPn7nRXMUo3vs6J0pto2DTn)
![and then](//storage.googleapis.com/support-kms-prod/Th2Tx0uwPMOhsMPn7nRXMUo3vs6J0pto2DTn)

[Learn more at the Google Workspace Learning Center](/a/users/answer/9310268)

[Back to top ![](//storage.googleapis.com/support-kms-prod/zHHKMD6GSdDAAu4oBhTQPRgAXdaMqQjzkthj)](#top)

![](//storage.googleapis.com/support-kms-prod/zHHKMD6GSdDAAu4oBhTQPRgAXdaMqQjzkthj)

## Consolidate product information in one website

![](//storage.googleapis.com/support-kms-prod/BSa5YBhh4sIVEtou5SLnrm7fn48swpkx115q)

Keeping track of new product plans and resources can be time-consuming, especially if you’re managing different product teams across the globe. Keep your product information, designs, KPIs, budget costs, and documents in one place with a Google Sites website. Now everyone in your organization—no matter where they’re located—can keep up to date on the product development process.

#### Create & name your site

The name you create here is the document name that appears in Google Drive.

Choose an option:

![and then](//storage.googleapis.com/support-kms-prod/Th2Tx0uwPMOhsMPn7nRXMUo3vs6J0pto2DTn)
![and then](//storage.googleapis.com/support-kms-prod/Th2Tx0uwPMOhsMPn7nRXMUo3vs6J0pto2DTn)

[Learn more at the Google Sites Help Center](/sites/answer/98081)

[Back to top ![](//storage.googleapis.com/support-kms-prod/zHHKMD6GSdDAAu4oBhTQPRgAXdaMqQjzkthj)](#top)

![](//storage.googleapis.com/support-kms-prod/zHHKMD6GSdDAAu4oBhTQPRgAXdaMqQjzkthj)

## Showcase new product ideas

![](//storage.googleapis.com/support-kms-prod/BSa5YBhh4sIVEtou5SLnrm7fn48swpkx115q)

Want to share a new idea for a product or process? Quickly get your organization onboard with a Google Slides presentation that describes details, outlines market-research strategies, establishes budgets and key timelines, and more. Make your presentation even more dynamic by using Google Workspace with Gemini in Slides to generate and add visuals, such as images and graphs.

Some concepts are best explained with video. To create and edit your own videos, use Google Vids.

#### Create a presentation

![Plus](//lh3.googleusercontent.com/anBD83lVdJYMSbLhOXIulHzmEGPr0uJRfiomsujvgYDHF0UlSHRhpJWca3hcw68T5A=w36-h36)

You can also create new presentations from the URL <https://slides.google.com/create>.

[Learn more at the Google Docs Editors Help Center](/docs/answer/2763168)

#### Create images based on slide content with Gemini

![](//storage.googleapis.com/support-kms-prod/z2n6jwzByrOdxbU2XPSsPkW9n3F4TfFNekhg)
![](//storage.googleapis.com/support-kms-prod/zbUHpfyBhBjtdndtTvFGA8LuTQFfCY4Cilmh)
![](//storage.googleapis.com/support-kms-prod/LH7j6MfB0oIBmzJH4ReBR0lZ4JjgQv5ptm2J)
![](//storage.googleapis.com/support-kms-prod/JcqXiigN2qlpkdRYo1YtW2gauI6kbxrpppaP)
![](//storage.googleapis.com/support-kms-prod/0r1BrCsIxXSjNWH8tUx3qcDnZ4qYooT8Cbzf)
![](//storage.googleapis.com/support-kms-prod/ELMVdsslajYvA0uKP2gW5TBAhYrdULvEk5UI)

[Get started with Google Slides](/a/users/answer/14514640)

#### Generate a new slide with Gemini

You can use the Gemini in Slides side panel to generate a new slide.

![](//storage.googleapis.com/support-kms-prod/z2n6jwzByrOdxbU2XPSsPkW9n3F4TfFNekhg)
![](//storage.googleapis.com/support-kms-prod/jNPzrPZQGJx99LZGPevbkVj1L3TVLDNKYd5z)
![](//storage.googleapis.com/support-kms-prod/Ika2XjAL3ZZdYFzPx08s16Yo5CWImXZ69sjR)
![](//storage.googleapis.com/support-kms-prod/pIz6iI5mp6URLhFtIqe8Jck2IFeKhUXaTCA4)
![](//storage.googleapis.com/support-kms-prod/LH7j6MfB0oIBmzJH4ReBR0lZ4JjgQv5ptm2J)
![](//storage.googleapis.com/support-kms-prod/JcqXiigN2qlpkdRYo1YtW2gauI6kbxrpppaP)

[Get started with Slides](/a/users/answer/9313043)

#### Create a video with Vids

[Get started with Google Vids](/a/users/answer/14817658)

[Back to top ![](//storage.googleapis.com/support-kms-prod/zHHKMD6GSdDAAu4oBhTQPRgAXdaMqQjzkthj)](#top)

![](//storage.googleapis.com/support-kms-prod/zHHKMD6GSdDAAu4oBhTQPRgAXdaMqQjzkthj)

## Collect product feedback from customers

![](//storage.googleapis.com/support-kms-prod/BSa5YBhh4sIVEtou5SLnrm7fn48swpkx115q)

When a product is in the early stages of development, create a market research survey using Google Forms to capture customer feedback. Product managers can then sort, organize, and [analyze the results in Sheets](/docs/answer/139706) to improve product quality. Embed the results on an internal website using Sites so the entire team knows the best way to move the product forward.

#### Create a form

![Plus](//lh3.googleusercontent.com/anBD83lVdJYMSbLhOXIulHzmEGPr0uJRfiomsujvgYDHF0UlSHRhpJWca3hcw68T5A=w36-h36)

#### Add a Sheets file to your site

![and then](//lh3.googleusercontent.com/3_l97rr0GvhSP2XV5OoCkV2ZDTIisAOczrSdzNCBxhIKWrjXjHucxNwocghoUa39gw=w36-h36)

[Back to top ![](//storage.googleapis.com/support-kms-prod/zHHKMD6GSdDAAu4oBhTQPRgAXdaMqQjzkthj)](#top)

![](//storage.googleapis.com/support-kms-prod/zHHKMD6GSdDAAu4oBhTQPRgAXdaMqQjzkthj)

## Collaborate on documents

![](//storage.googleapis.com/support-kms-prod/BSa5YBhh4sIVEtou5SLnrm7fn48swpkx115q)

If your organization is developing new products or processes, you need an easy way to manage documentation requirements. With Google Docs, you can create documents for product guidelines, design notes, research data, and more. Want to brainstorm a new product with your team? Create a document and instantly share it so everyone can contribute ideas. People can edit documents together in real time, chat within files, and get targeted feedback using comments and suggestions.

#### Create your document

![Plus](//lh3.googleusercontent.com/anBD83lVdJYMSbLhOXIulHzmEGPr0uJRfiomsujvgYDHF0UlSHRhpJWca3hcw68T5A=w36-h36)

You can also:

#### 

#### Chat with collaborators

![Chat](//storage.googleapis.com/support-kms-prod/l6NgCSwpbnCBo6BJl2KVt3hn4iH9ZbHjlddn)
![and then](//lh3.googleusercontent.com/3_l97rr0GvhSP2XV5OoCkV2ZDTIisAOczrSdzNCBxhIKWrjXjHucxNwocghoUa39gw=w36-h36)
![Chat](//storage.googleapis.com/support-kms-prod/l6NgCSwpbnCBo6BJl2KVt3hn4iH9ZbHjlddn)
![Close](//lh3.googleusercontent.com/HeKfXR_n2o5Sulz6SR7L4a5IpKPi0rO2rpEgUU2nOH2tUqJam2-ZTXMARAN-3gauDuk=h36)

**Note:** All chats in Google Docs, Sheets, and Slides include anyone viewing the file. The chats aren't saved.

[Back to top ![](//storage.googleapis.com/support-kms-prod/zHHKMD6GSdDAAu4oBhTQPRgAXdaMqQjzkthj)](#top)

![](//storage.googleapis.com/support-kms-prod/zHHKMD6GSdDAAu4oBhTQPRgAXdaMqQjzkthj)

## Hold video meetings with your team

![](//storage.googleapis.com/support-kms-prod/BSa5YBhh4sIVEtou5SLnrm7fn48swpkx115q)

Want to schedule a meeting with one of your suppliers across the globe? Hold instant video meetings between design teams, suppliers, sourcing teams, manufacturers, and more using Google Meet. Or, join a video meeting to brainstorm ideas for new products, get virtual feedback on a product in progress, or instantly share task updates. Everyone on the product team can easily and regularly communicate without traveling and still get the benefit of face-to-face contact—all from a computer or mobile device.

![](//storage.googleapis.com/support-kms-prod/2OS7Vwl0OhmeZCyKtSVr7abdfI5IWdnUdGp2)
![and then](//lh3.googleusercontent.com/3_l97rr0GvhSP2XV5OoCkV2ZDTIisAOczrSdzNCBxhIKWrjXjHucxNwocghoUa39gw=w36-h36)

**Tip**: Google Workspace Essentials users can't schedule a meeting in Google Calendar.

[Learn more at the Google Meet Help Center](/meet/answer/9302870)

[Back to top ![](//storage.googleapis.com/support-kms-prod/zHHKMD6GSdDAAu4oBhTQPRgAXdaMqQjzkthj)](#top)

![](//storage.googleapis.com/support-kms-prod/zHHKMD6GSdDAAu4oBhTQPRgAXdaMqQjzkthj)

## Connect with co-workers using one address

![](//storage.googleapis.com/support-kms-prod/BSa5YBhh4sIVEtou5SLnrm7fn48swpkx115q)

Want to reduce the time you spend emailing different members of product teams? Need to share the same information with designers, suppliers, or manufacturers across the globe? Make communication easier by creating an email list for your team using Google Groups. Instead of emailing people individually, use the group’s email address to send status updates and share resources with everyone at once.

#### Create a group

[Learn more at the Google Groups Help Center](/groups/answer/2464926)

[Back to top ![](//storage.googleapis.com/support-kms-prod/zHHKMD6GSdDAAu4oBhTQPRgAXdaMqQjzkthj)](#top)

![](//storage.googleapis.com/support-kms-prod/zHHKMD6GSdDAAu4oBhTQPRgAXdaMqQjzkthj)

## Manage meetings & product updates

![](//storage.googleapis.com/support-kms-prod/BSa5YBhh4sIVEtou5SLnrm7fn48swpkx115q)

![](//storage.googleapis.com/support-kms-prod/BSa5YBhh4sIVEtou5SLnrm7fn48swpkx115q)

If you’re working with different product teams in remote locations and operating in multiple time zones, it can be challenging to keep track of everyone’s availability. With Calendar, you can layer your team members’ calendars to see when everyone is free. Or, create different shared team calendars so everyone is aware of key meetings, trainings, product updates, and deadlines.

![](//storage.googleapis.com/support-kms-prod/IjVghmzcAwomu6FHWarYuF47OEZeDqhQbZpd)

#### See others' calendars side by side

You can see guests' calendars side by side in Day view when you create an event. To turn on Day view in Calendar, go to Settings ![](//lh3.googleusercontent.com/esYvnQYqTY6dRiUgxyCc8kInS5FCVNfiYr_o9fDccm9xtXYU5Oq_z7eDAH-iIfbqMg=h36)![and then](//lh3.googleusercontent.com/3_l97rr0GvhSP2XV5OoCkV2ZDTIisAOczrSdzNCBxhIKWrjXjHucxNwocghoUa39gw=w36-h36)**Settings**![and then](//lh3.googleusercontent.com/3_l97rr0GvhSP2XV5OoCkV2ZDTIisAOczrSdzNCBxhIKWrjXjHucxNwocghoUa39gw=w36-h36)**View options**.

![](//lh3.googleusercontent.com/esYvnQYqTY6dRiUgxyCc8kInS5FCVNfiYr_o9fDccm9xtXYU5Oq_z7eDAH-iIfbqMg=h36)
![and then](//lh3.googleusercontent.com/3_l97rr0GvhSP2XV5OoCkV2ZDTIisAOczrSdzNCBxhIKWrjXjHucxNwocghoUa39gw=w36-h36)
![and then](//lh3.googleusercontent.com/3_l97rr0GvhSP2XV5OoCkV2ZDTIisAOczrSdzNCBxhIKWrjXjHucxNwocghoUa39gw=w36-h36)
![Plus](//lh3.googleusercontent.com/anBD83lVdJYMSbLhOXIulHzmEGPr0uJRfiomsujvgYDHF0UlSHRhpJWca3hcw68T5A=w36-h36)
![and then](//lh3.googleusercontent.com/3_l97rr0GvhSP2XV5OoCkV2ZDTIisAOczrSdzNCBxhIKWrjXjHucxNwocghoUa39gw=w36-h36)

**Note:** To check if a room is available, click **Add rooms** or **Add location**. Then, choose a room.

#### Create a team calendar & share it with people

**Important**: You can only create new calendars from a browser. After you create a calendar, you can find it on your browser and in the Calendar app.

# Alphabet: research and development expenditure 2013-2024

In 2024, Alphabet spent 49.32 billion U.S. dollars on research and development across its many properties. This is an increase of over 3.8 billion U.S. dollars compared to the company's R&D expenses in the previous year.

This help content & information

General Help Center experience

Next

*   [Help Center](https://support.google.com/business/?hl=en)
*   [Community](https://support.google.com/business/community?hl=en&help_center_link=CKrlsQMSHlZlcmlmeSB5b3VyIGJ1c2luZXNzIG9uIEdvb2dsZQ)
*   [Get-Started Guide](https://support.google.com/business/announcements/9239041)

[Google Business Profile](https://business.google.com/)

Verify your business on Google
==============================

To update your business info, like name and operating hours on Google, and interact with customers, verify your business.

[](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bSj2-_fqc5U)

Step 1: Find your business
--------------------------

Find your business on Google

**Important:** To find your profile, you must sign in to the Google Account associated with it.

Try any of these methods to find your profile.

*   On Google Search, search for your business's name and city or `my business`.

![Image 1: Search for your business through Google Search](https://storage.googleapis.com/support-kms-prod/XTZ1ddYx6yOveJ1TNFqyAf7jVHTyudph1nHh)

*   On Google Maps, search for your business's name and city.

![Image 2: Search for your business through Google Maps](https://storage.googleapis.com/support-kms-prod/W5h6FbBTWZwCqDwjooRbAVihgx9ArGGwirKC)

*   In the Google Maps app ![Image 3: Maps](https://storage.googleapis.com/support-kms-prod/zvYEMw88qc8J2qhmJrzVWX85sBovhBKB9FR9), at the bottom right, tap **Business**.
    *   If you have more than one business:
        1.  At the top, tap the Down arrow ![Image 4: Down arrow](https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/IIlMIHs6edGAoEBajArZMbav6CPLDOC9pwBc7kDwG_-Jkpub7KcEpjRbgqNHUiUCIw=w36).
        2.  Select the business you want to view.

![Image 5: Search for your business through Google Maps app](https://storage.googleapis.com/support-kms-prod/9YAHw1d6iYPOTlcDXTToCpLy7H9X5ow8HZwS)

If needed: Add or claim your business on Google

**If your business isn’t on Google yet:** Add it then continue to the next step.

[Learn how to add or claim your Business Profile on Google](https://support.google.com/business/answer/2911778).

**Important:** Make sure your business address is correct and meets our guidelines. [Learn about our address guidelines](https://support.google.com/business/answer/2853879).

**If you haven’t claimed your business yet:** Claim your business so you can verify it and control how it shows up on Google. [Learn how to add or claim your Business Profile on Google](https://support.google.com/business/answer/2911778).

Step 2: Verify your business
----------------------------

To verify your business, try the options available for your Business Profile. The verification options available to your business are based on factors like your business category, public info, region, or business hours.

**Important:**

*   Your verification options can’t be changed because Google’s systems automatically determine and show which methods your business can use.
*   In some cases, you may need to verify your business using more than one method.

Video recording

To verify your business, you can record a video that shows the details of your business. All businesses eligible for a profile can be verified through video.

[Learn how to verify your business with a video recording](https://support.google.com/business/answer/14271705).

Phone or text

**Important:** To get your verification code, make sure you can answer your business phone number or receive texts. Interactive Voice Response (IVR) systems will not get the code.

1.  [Go to your Business Profile](https://business.google.com/).
2.  Click **Get verified** ![Image 6: and then](https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/3_l97rr0GvhSP2XV5OoCkV2ZDTIisAOczrSdzNCBxhIKWrjXjHucxNwocghoUa39gw=w36-h36) **Phone** or **SMS**.
3.  Answer the call or open the text with the code.
4.  In your profile, enter the code.

Email

**Important:** Make sure you can use the email address in the verification screen.

1.  [Go to your Business Profile](http://business.google.com/?skipLandingPage=true&gmbsrc=ww-ww-et-gs-z-gmb-v-z-h~bhc-core-u%7Cmybb).
2.  Click **Get verified** ![Image 7: and then](https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/3_l97rr0GvhSP2XV5OoCkV2ZDTIisAOczrSdzNCBxhIKWrjXjHucxNwocghoUa39gw=w36-h36) **Email**.
3.  Follow the steps in the email.

Live video call

**Important:**

*   Verification by live video call may not be available for all businesses. Please try the options available to you, and if you're still unable to verify your business, please contact support.
*   Live video call is only available within the business hours of your respective location.

#### Step 1: Get ready for the call

*   Make sure you have a mobile device that can join a live video call.
*   Confirm that you’re at your business. Make sure you can demonstrate your location and ownership on the video call. For example:
    *   **Your current location:** Show outside signs. Examples include your street’s name, nearby businesses, or the area around your business.
    *   **Business or equipment:** Capture your operations. Examples include stock for sale, branded equipment, marketing materials, or tools you use to serve your customers.
    *   **Proof of management:** Show your access to employee-only items or areas. Examples include a cash register, kitchen, storage room, or non-sensitive business documents. You can also use your keys to open your facility.

#### Step 2: Start a text chat

1.  [Go to your Business Profile](http://business.google.com/?skipLandingPage=true&gmbsrc=ww-ww-et-gs-z-gmb-v-z-h~bhc-core-u%7Cmybb).
2.  Tap **Get verified** ![Image 8: and then](https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/3_l97rr0GvhSP2XV5OoCkV2ZDTIisAOczrSdzNCBxhIKWrjXjHucxNwocghoUa39gw=w36-h36) **Live video call** ![Image 9: and then](https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/3_l97rr0GvhSP2XV5OoCkV2ZDTIisAOczrSdzNCBxhIKWrjXjHucxNwocghoUa39gw=w36-h36) **Next**.
3.  Select your language.
4.  To start a text chat with the next available support representative, tap **Start call**.

#### Step 3: Show your business through video call with a mobile device

1.  When a representative is available, they’ll help you join a video call.
2.  To show your business location and ownership, use the camera on your device.

Mail

If verification by mail is available in your Business Profile and you choose this method, we’ll mail you a verification code. To confirm that your business is at the listed address, you must enter your unique code on your profile.

**Important:** Verification by postcard may not be available for all businesses. Please try the options available to you, and if you're still unable to verify your business, please contact support.

#### Step 1: Request your code

Most codes arrive within 14 days.

1.  [Go to your Business Profile](http://business.google.com/?skipLandingPage=true&gmbsrc=ww-ww-et-gs-z-gmb-v-z-h~bhc-core-u%7Cmybb).
2.  Click **Get verified** ![Image 10: and then](https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/3_l97rr0GvhSP2XV5OoCkV2ZDTIisAOczrSdzNCBxhIKWrjXjHucxNwocghoUa39gw=w36-h36) **Postcard**.
3.  Make sure your business’s mailing address is correct.
4.  Request the code.

#### Step 2: Wait for your code to arrive through mail

**Important:**

*   Do not edit your business name, address, or category on your Business Profile. If you do, the code we sent you won’t work.
*   Do not request a new code. If you do, we invalidate the code in the mail and send a new one. This can make the process longer.
*   Verification codes expire after 30 days.

#### Step 3: When the postcard arrives with the verification code, enter the code on your business profile

**Important:**

*   Keep this code secure.
*   Google won’t call you to ask for the verification code.
*   Do not share the verification code with anyone. This includes third parties who help manage your business on Google.

1.  [Go to your Business Profile](http://business.google.com/?skipLandingPage=true&gmbsrc=ww-ww-et-gs-z-gmb-v-z-h~bhc-core-u%7Cmybb).
2.  In the “Code” field, enter your 5-digit verification code.
3.  Click **Submit**.

Step 3: Wait up to 5 business days to be verified
-------------------------------------------------

After you follow the verification steps, Google reviews the info you provided. To help maintain the integrity of your Business Profile, verification review can take up to 5 business days.

**Tip:** In some cases, Google verifies a profile instantly. This can happen when:

*   You verify your website with Google Search Console. [Learn how to add a website property in Search Console](https://support.google.com/webmasters/answer/34592).
*   You use bulk verification. [Learn how to verify 10 or more locations of the same business in bulk](https://support.google.com/business/answer/4490296).

Step 4: You’re verified
-----------------------

When your business is verified, you’ll receive a confirmation email.

**Tip:** If a third party helps you manage your profile, you can add them to your profile after you’re verified.

*   [Learn how to add and remove profile owners and managers](https://support.google.com/business/answer/3403100).
*   [Learn how to transfer profile ownership to the third party](https://support.google.com/business/answer/3415281).
*   [Learn how to request ownership of a business profile](https://support.google.com/business/answer/4566671).

Fix verification issues or verify your business again
-----------------------------------------------------

In some cases, Google may find issues about your verification. You can either fix these verification issues or verify your business again.

“Get verified” button appears on your profile again

When the “Get verified” button appears on your Business Profile again, Google can’t completely verify your business. To fix this issue, try to verify again.

If your Business Profile shows multiple verification options, you can try to verify another way. [Learn how to verify your business](https://support.google.com/business/answer/7107242#verify_business).

“Review issues” notification

When you verify with a video recording and get a “Review issues” notification, your video wasn’t accepted. To fix this issue:

1.  Click **Review issues**.
2.  Follow the on-screen instructions.

Give additional info to re-verify

If you’re asked to give additional info to re-verify your profile, this is likely because you changed some info about your business. To make sure your business info is accurate, Google might ask you to give more details or update your info.

To fix this issue, click **Get Verified** and try to verify again. [Learn how to verify your business](https://support.google.com/business/answer/7107242#verify_business).

**Tip:** For more help with verification, [ask a question in our community forum](https://support.google.com/business/community).

Next steps
----------

*   [Add or edit your business address for your Business Profile](https://support.google.com/business/answer/2853879)
*   [Edit your Business Profile on Google](https://support.google.com/business/answer/3039617)
*   [About posts for your Business Profile](https://support.google.com/business/answer/7662907)
*   [Read & reply to reviews on Google](https://support.google.com/business/answer/3474050)
*   [How to chat with customers from your Business Profile](https://support.google.com/business/answer/15013580)

Need more help?

*   [Get-Started Guide](https://support.google.com/business/announcements/9239041)

[Google Business Profile](https://business.google.com/)

Get started with Google Business Profile
========================================

With a Business Profile on Google, you can manage how your business shows up on Maps and Search. Whether you own a storefront business or provide services where your customers are, a verified Business Profile can help customers find you and build greater trust in your business.

With a Business Profile on Google Maps and Search, you can:

*   **Maintain accurate information about your business online:**
    *   Provide your business hours, website, phone number, and location so they’re visible to customers on Google. Depending on your business category, your location can be a street address, service area, or place marker.
    *   Stay up-to-date with your online presence on Google Maps and Search.
*   **Interact with customers:**
    *   Post photos and videos of your business and the products and services it offers.
    *   Collect and respond to reviews from customers.
*   **Attract new customers:**
    *   Improve how your business appears online so new customers can find you.
    *   Direct customers to your website, social media, booking links, and more.
    *   To reach an even larger audience, consider the use of location-based ads with [Smart campaigns in Google Ads](https://support.google.com/google-ads/answer/7457632).

[Manage your Business Profile directly on Google](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KyVIM3EDiu8)

Determine if a Business Profile is right for your business
----------------------------------------------------------

For storefront and service-area businesses, sign up for a Business Profile

[Add or claim your business](https://support.google.com/business?p=LC_add)

For businesses that interact with customers in-person during business hours, like retail stores and service providers that visit customers, a Business Profile can be beneficial. Business Profiles aren’t for online-only businesses nor properties for rent or sale. [Learn more about business eligibility and ownership guidelines](https://support.google.com/business/answer/13763036).

For larger businesses with multiple locations, use the Business Profile Manager tool to manage your profiles in bulk. [Learn more about bulk location management](https://support.google.com/business/answer/3217744).

To get started, [learn how to add or claim your Business Profile](https://support.google.com/business/answer/2911778).

For online-only businesses, sign up for Smart campaigns

[Sign up for Smart campaigns](https://ads.google.com/um/StartNow?sourceid=awo&subid=ww-ww-et-gmbhc-7025532)

Only businesses that make face-to-face contact with customers are eligible for a Business Profile. If your online-only business doesn’t have a physical location that your customers can visit nor do you visit customers in-person, your business isn’t eligible. [Learn more about business eligibility and ownership guidelines](https://support.google.com/business/answer/13763036).

Even if you aren't eligible for a Business Profile, you can still grow your business with Smart campaigns in Google Ads, an easy-to-use online advertising platform. [Learn more about Smart campaigns](https://support.google.com/google-ads/answer/7457632).

Sign up for a Business Profile
------------------------------

[Add or claim your business](https://support.google.com/business?p=LC_add)

*   If you own or manage an eligible business, you can create a Business Profile. [Learn how to add or claim your Business Profile](https://support.google.com/business/answer/2911778).
    *   **Tip**: If you get a message that someone else has already verified the business, you can [request ownership of the Business Profile](https://support.google.com/business/answer/4566671).
*   If you verify a Business Profile, you can make changes to it on Google Maps and Search. [Learn how to verify your business](https://support.google.com/business/answer/7107242).
*   Once you’ve verified your Business Profile, you can manage your business information. [Learn how to edit your Business Profile](https://support.google.com/business/answer/3039617).

**Tips:**

*   To find how others view your profile, you can browse privately in [Google Chrome](https://support.google.com/chrome/answer/95464) or in [Google Maps](https://support.google.com/maps/answer/9430563). [Learn how to find your business on Google](https://support.google.com/business/answer/145585).
    
*   To update your Business Profile, Google uses various sources such as user reports and licensed content. [Learn how to manage Google updates](https://support.google.com/business/answer/3480441).
    

Manage access to your Business Profile
--------------------------------------

*   If you want to add additional owners and managers to help you manage your profile, you can [learn how to update access to your profile.](https://support.google.com/business/answer/3403100)
*   If you no longer want to manage your profile, you can [transfer primary ownership of a Business Profile](https://support.google.com/business/answer/3415281).
*   If you want to remove a closed business from your Google Account, you can learn how to [remove the Business Profile from your account](https://support.google.com/business/answer/4669092).

Related resources
-----------------

*   [Manage your business information](https://support.google.com/business/topic/4596687)
*   [Manage profile ownership](https://support.google.com/business/topic/4539640)
*   [Manage your profile settings](https://support.google.com/business/topic/11497815)

Need more help?

results.raw_content:
Create a company profile
      


      
      Stay organized with collections
    

      
      Save and categorize content based on your preferences.

The Google Home Developer Console offers a place to record basic information about
your company that is used by Google for marketing and promotion as well as for
Matter certification.

To fill out your Company profile:

Go to the Developer Console

From the list of projects, click Open next to the project you want to
work with.

Click Project home.

Click Project Details, where you'll see the Company profile card and
the status Incomplete.



Click Submit profile.

Company info

Under Basic info, enter the company name and the company website URL.

Under Company assets, upload a 192x192px company logo in either JPG or
PNG format, which is
used in marketing and promotion, as well as for Cloud-to-cloud
integrations, where applicable, such as in the Google Home app (GHA).

Under Privacy policy, enter the web URL for your company's privacy
policy.

Contact information

Provide the address of the company headquarters and select the country from
the drop-down menu.

Provide at least one contact of each type, up to a maximum of three for each
of the three contact categories (Developer contacts, Marketing contacts, and
Business contacts).

Each contact has its own name, email address, and company.

Click addAdd contact to add a
contact.

To delete a contact, click the
do_not_disturb_on button next to the one
you want to delete.



Marketing and promotion options

In the final section of the Company profile, you may opt-in to receiving
marketing and promotional communication from Google. By default, you are opted
out from all selections.

Review process

When you are satisfied with the company profile information you've entered,
click Submit.

After submission, your entries are reviewed by Google. While under review, the
Company profile card will display the status In review in yellow.

If your company profile is rejected, the status will show Rejected in red,
followed by the Google policy violations that caused the rejection. You have the
opportunity to revise your submission and resubmit
for approval.

Once your company profile is approved, the status will show Live in
green and will automatically go into effect for all launched integrations.



Edit the company profile

You can edit your company profile at any time. If you edit the profile while it
is still under review, your most recent changes replace any previous edits. To
modify your company profile:

Go to the Developer Console

From the list of projects, click Open next to the project you want to
work with.

Click Project home.

Click Project Details and go to the Company profile card.

Click Submit profile.

Make the necessary changes, then click Submit to submit your changes for
review.

Imported projects

The Company Profile for an imported project can only be edited
  in the Actions on Google
    Console. Changes there will be reflected in the Google Home Developer
  Console.

Check or delete your Chrome browsing history
============================================

Websites you’ve visited are recorded in your browsing history. You can check or delete your browsing history, and find related searches in Chrome. You can also resume browsing sessions on other devices if you’re signed in and have your history synced to your Google Account.

When you delete your browsing history in Chrome, it’s also deleted on your devices where you’re signed in to Chrome and have your history synced to your Google Account.

**Tip:**Separately, you can also [delete your Google search history from your account](https://support.google.com/accounts/answer/465).

Android Computer iPhone & iPad

More
1.   More

Understand and manage your Chrome history
-----------------------------------------

What your History lists

Your History lists the pages you've visited on Chrome in the last 90 days. It doesn't store:

*   Chrome pages like chrome://settings
*   Pages you’ve visited while you browse privately in [Incognito mode](https://support.google.com/chrome/answer/95464)
*   Deleted pages from your browsing history

**Tip:** If you’re signed in to Chrome and sync your history, then your History also shows pages you’ve visited on your other devices.

Find your history

1.   On your Android device, open Chrome ![Image 1: Chrome](https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/54OLzqJjsX2y9wWe3wl8tW3v9CqlihFJf-iV4iWp_p1b9dpZyU0v6m4gZ5VeOPvdrcei=h36).
2.   At the top right, tap More ![Image 2: More](https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/E2q6Vj9j60Dw0Z6NZFEx5vSB9yoZJp7C8suuvQXVA_2weMCXstGD7JEvNrzX3wuQrPtL=w36-h36)![Image 3: and then](https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/3_l97rr0GvhSP2XV5OoCkV2ZDTIisAOczrSdzNCBxhIKWrjXjHucxNwocghoUa39gw=w36-h36)**History**. 
    *   If your address bar is at the bottom, swipe up on the address bar. Tap History ![Image 4](https://storage.googleapis.com/support-kms-prod/dWh9OjlKoe5FeeYdQJQlDWkxMFYYaRS6WSP2).

3.   To visit a site, tap the entry. 
    *   To open the site in a new tab, touch and hold the entry. At the top right, tap More ![Image 5: More](https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/E2q6Vj9j60Dw0Z6NZFEx5vSB9yoZJp7C8suuvQXVA_2weMCXstGD7JEvNrzX3wuQrPtL=w36-h36)![Image 6: and then](https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/3_l97rr0GvhSP2XV5OoCkV2ZDTIisAOczrSdzNCBxhIKWrjXjHucxNwocghoUa39gw=w36-h36)**Open in new tab**.
    *   To copy the site, touch and hold the entry. At the top right, tap More ![Image 7: More](https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/E2q6Vj9j60Dw0Z6NZFEx5vSB9yoZJp7C8suuvQXVA_2weMCXstGD7JEvNrzX3wuQrPtL=w36-h36)![Image 8: and then](https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/3_l97rr0GvhSP2XV5OoCkV2ZDTIisAOczrSdzNCBxhIKWrjXjHucxNwocghoUa39gw=w36-h36)**Copy link**.

**Tip:** If you don’t want Chrome to save your browsing history, you can [browse in private with Incognito mode](https://support.google.com/chrome/answer/95464).

Delete items from your Chrome history
-------------------------------------

Delete your history and browsing data

1.   On your Android device, open Chrome ![Image 9: Chrome](https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/54OLzqJjsX2y9wWe3wl8tW3v9CqlihFJf-iV4iWp_p1b9dpZyU0v6m4gZ5VeOPvdrcei=h36).
2.   At the top right, tap More ![Image 10: More](https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/E2q6Vj9j60Dw0Z6NZFEx5vSB9yoZJp7C8suuvQXVA_2weMCXstGD7JEvNrzX3wuQrPtL=w36-h36)![Image 11: and then](https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/3_l97rr0GvhSP2XV5OoCkV2ZDTIisAOczrSdzNCBxhIKWrjXjHucxNwocghoUa39gw=w36-h36)**Delete browsing data**.
3.   Next to "Time range:" 
    *   To delete a portion of your history, select the dates.
    *   To delete everything, tap **All time**.

4.   Check the box next to "Browsing history."
5.   Uncheck any other data you don't want to delete.
6.   Tap **Delete data**.

**Tip:**[Learn how to delete your search history](https://support.google.com/websearch/answer/465).

Delete an item from your history

1.   On your Android device, open Chrome ![Image 12: Chrome](https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/54OLzqJjsX2y9wWe3wl8tW3v9CqlihFJf-iV4iWp_p1b9dpZyU0v6m4gZ5VeOPvdrcei=h36).
2.   At the top right, tap More ![Image 13: More](https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/E2q6Vj9j60Dw0Z6NZFEx5vSB9yoZJp7C8suuvQXVA_2weMCXstGD7JEvNrzX3wuQrPtL=w36-h36)![Image 14: and then](https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/3_l97rr0GvhSP2XV5OoCkV2ZDTIisAOczrSdzNCBxhIKWrjXjHucxNwocghoUa39gw=w36-h36)**History**. 
    *   If your address bar is at the bottom, swipe up on the address bar before you tap History ![Image 15](https://storage.googleapis.com/support-kms-prod/dWh9OjlKoe5FeeYdQJQlDWkxMFYYaRS6WSP2).

3.   Find the entry you want to delete.
4.   To the right, tap Remove ![Image 16: Remove](https://storage.googleapis.com/support-kms-prod/RSTzSkTq5rY7kKuIKty0fy8wHetndJT492DO).

To delete multiple items:

1.   Touch and hold an entry until you find a checkmark next to it.
2.   Select other sites you want to delete.
3.   At the top right, tap Remove ![Image 17: Remove](https://storage.googleapis.com/support-kms-prod/RSTzSkTq5rY7kKuIKty0fy8wHetndJT492DO).

**Tips:**

*   To search for something specific, at the top right, tap Search ![Image 18: Search](https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/Zv0iMGyZkxcm-PjpHG8tvHBQtW0g2SV59s0pWblj5vYThdjslgYYr7x9CP6fxCzv27M=w36-h36).
*   You can remove an item from a specific site’s history while on that site: 
    *   Tap Page info ![Image 19: Default (Secure)](https://storage.googleapis.com/support-kms-prod/S76Rs1BC1QDxT8zpF3tATLDsc5oxceWYIPHN)![Image 20: and then](https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/M1clyx8CUPwAH1XgxPTgbMx6sSwblyKIw2QAVv1HG_JrI2KCL4aMsSCCwq3zT1X2bm_n=h36) Last visited ![Image 21](https://storage.googleapis.com/support-kms-prod/dWh9OjlKoe5FeeYdQJQlDWkxMFYYaRS6WSP2)![Image 22: and then](https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/M1clyx8CUPwAH1XgxPTgbMx6sSwblyKIw2QAVv1HG_JrI2KCL4aMsSCCwq3zT1X2bm_n=h36) Remove ![Image 23: Remove](https://storage.googleapis.com/support-kms-prod/RSTzSkTq5rY7kKuIKty0fy8wHetndJT492DO).

#### Remove a shortcut image from New Tab page

1.   On your Android device, open Chrome ![Image 24: Chrome](https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/54OLzqJjsX2y9wWe3wl8tW3v9CqlihFJf-iV4iWp_p1b9dpZyU0v6m4gZ5VeOPvdrcei=h36).
2.   Open a new tab.
3.   Touch and hold the image you want to remove.
4.   Tap **Remove**.

Related resources
-----------------

*   [Search the web in Chrome](https://support.google.com/chrome/answer/95440)
*   [Set default search engine and site search shortcuts](https://support.google.com/chrome/answer/95426)
*   [Search your browsing history in Chrome with AI](https://support.google.com/chrome/answer/15305774)
*   [Remove unwanted ads, pop-ups & malware](https://support.google.com/chrome/answer/2765944)
